snippet: Bill de Blasio, who finished first in the Democratic mayoral primary, would need to capture about one-third of the votes left to be counted to avoid a runoff against William C. Thompson Jr.
abstract: Bill de Blasio, who finished first in New York City's Democratic mayoral primary, needs to capture about one-third of the votes left to be counted to avoid a runoff against William C Thompson Jr.
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio, who finished first in the Democratic mayoral primary, would need to capture about one-third of the votes left to be counted to avoid a runoff against William C. Thompson Jr.

headline.main: Election Math Works in Favor of de Blasio
headline.print_headline: Election Math Works in Favor Of de Blasio
